chineseMeaning: n. 膺品；伪造品; adj. 假冒的；假装的; v. 仿造；伪装；假装;
examples: This ten-dollar bill is a counterfeit.
We suspect the paper to be a counterfeit.

chineseMeaning: n. 法院；庭院；宫廷；球场；奉承; v. 献殷勤；追求；招致；设法获得;
examples: Sherman recommended that Clarke be disciplined, but higher-ups rejected the idea.
My court is deserted but I do not care.
The court of King Solomon was noted for its splendor.
The court moves to the country in the summer.
He dropped the ball to the back of the court .
The two players entered the court hand in hand.

chineseMeaning: adj. 贪婪的；贪心的；垂涎的;
examples: She shows a covetous look.
You are so covetous, eating the food in the bowl and looking at the pot.
He is covetous of her high salary.
He was casting covetous eyes at the company.

chineseMeaning: n. 懦弱;
examples: I've been accused of many things in my life, but never of cowardice.
He lost everything because of his cowardice.
He was disgusted at your cowardice.
Such an act of cowardice by an officer shames his whole regiment.
His cowardice in face of the enemy was contemptible.

chineseMeaning: vt. 确定无罪；免除责任;
adj. 外来的；异国的；奇异的；脱衣舞的;
examples: Exotic pets are the in thing right now.
The film retains much of the book's exotic flavour.
The taste of this exotic dish puts me off.
Some turned their hats into more exotic shapes.

chineseMeaning: vt. 加速；加快；有助于;
examples: The builders promised to expedite the repairs.
We will expedite shipment as much as possible.
Please do what you can to expedite the constuction.
We must expedite the construction of the Southwest area of our country.
This should expedite the process.
I will try to expedite the matter.

chineseMeaning: v. 赎罪；补偿；结束;
examples: He had a chance to confess and expiate his guilt.
He hoped to expiate his guilt.

chineseMeaning: n. 气化;
examples: Gasification is really a simple process.
Coal gas is produced by the gasification of coal.

chineseMeaning: adj. 俗丽的; n. (英)盛大宴会(尤指大学年会);
examples: He dislikes gaudy decorations.
These are cheap and gaudy clothes.
She wore a gaudy costume to the party.

chineseMeaning: n. 传动装置；齿轮；排挡；工具；装备; v. 调整；使适应于；以齿轮连起;
examples: Careless use of the clutch may damage the gears.
The gear just would not come unstuck.
The car has four forward gear and one reverse gear.
Lifting electromagnet is a kind of lifting gear.
Hundreds of police in riot gear struggled to control the violence.
We need to sort out our camping gear before we go away.

chineseMeaning: adj. 文雅的；有教养的;
examples: She is too genteel for words.
You are genteel enough, you look like a lady.

chineseMeaning: n. 杰出人物；发光体;
adj. 苍翠繁茂的；茂盛的；丰富的; n. 酒；酒鬼; v. 喝酒;
examples: Ireland is famous for its lush green hills.
The lush vegetation spoke of a damper climate here.
The hills are covered in lush green vegetation.
Lush atmospheric touches in every room.

chineseMeaning: adj. 笨拙的;
examples: We knew that he had some problems somewhere from his maladroit movements.
Our new supervisor is clever in matters in which his predecessor was maladroit.

chineseMeaning: adj. 不服的；不满的; n. 不满者；反叛者;
examples: But she fears the husband is malcontent to this, even rebuff.
We must admit that these statistics reflect many malcontent mood.

chineseMeaning: adj. 有害的；恶性的；有恶意的; v. 诽谤；中伤；说坏话;
examples: A malign tumour was found in his stomach.
Malign fate had broken their necks, perhaps, but never their hearts.

chineseMeaning: adj. 可塑的；易改变的；有延展性;
examples: Lead and tin are malleable metals.
The human brain is almost infinitely malleable.
The young are more malleable than the old.
Every time we recall a long-term memory, it becomes malleable.

chineseMeaning: adj. 说话粗鄙恶劣的；无礼的；下流的；恶言诽谤的;
examples: She is often quite scurrilous in her reference to me.
The hoodlums defiled the church with their scurrilous writing.
I shall not reply to such a scurrilous attack upon me.
She was frightened by an utterly false accusation and an utterly scurrilous threat.

chineseMeaning: adj. 丑恶的；有伤痕的；有接缝的;
vt. 隐藏；隐匿; vt. 分泌;
examples: He found the money secreted in a drawer.
Squirrels secrete a supply of nuts for winter.
The kidneys secrete urine.
Tears are secreted by an organ under the upper eyelid.

chineseMeaning: adj. 久坐的；固定不动的;
examples: People in sedentary jobs need to take exercise.
We should do away with the sedentary lifestyle.

chineseMeaning: adj. 苍白的；病态的；暗淡的; vi. 变苍白；呈病态; abbr. 广域网（=wide area network);
examples: Her face wan after her long illness.
The child looked pale and wan.

chineseMeaning: n. 衰落；亏缺；变弱; v. 变小；亏缺；呈下弦;
examples: The empire was on the wane after its period of prosperity.
By now the power of the Roman Empire was on the wane.
The sick man's strength is on the wane.
The government's popularity is on the wane.

chineseMeaning: n. 战争贩子；好战者；主战论者;
examples: The Socialists were trying to smear Churchill as a warmonger.
